New Records: Anthony Davis recorded 31 points and 14 rebounds, matching the 30-point threshold for the eighth time in 12 games this season.
Dalton Knecht scored a career-high 27 points as a rookie for the Lakers.
Key Match Events: LeBron James made two pivotal three-pointers in the final minutes to turn the game in favor of the Lakers.
The Lakers outscored the Pelicans 52-40 in the paint, a key factor in their victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers were on a five-game winning streak entering the match.
Cam Reddish was rested due to a lower right leg injury.
Post-Match Reflections: The Pelicans, despite missing key players, kept the game competitive with their energy and effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was significant as it extended the Lakers' winning streak and highlighted the return of Anthony Davis to form after a recent 40-point performance.
Others: The Lakers and Pelicans both have upcoming games in the NBA Cup, with the Lakers facing the Utah Jazz and the Pelicans playing against the Dallas Mavericks.
